Game is a bit old, but still offers a lot of good game. I like it. You like it?

Game has very little bugs for being so old.

Story is immersive and fun. Multiplayer is fast and feels very smooth.

Una obra maestra. 
 Empezó a hacer algo que a día de hoy esta normalizado y explotado, las campañas detalladas de los first person shooter, a pesar de de estar hecho en 1998 usaron los recursos que tenían para hacer una historia que en su momento atrajo y sigue atrayendo a la gente, con misterios que todavía no se pudieron resolver (porque no salio la tercera entrega), personajes carismaticos, un entorno nuevo y original. 
 Es algo que si o si tenes que jugar.

I remember myself playing this as a toddler. I wanted to turn the volume down for the experiment and my parents turning it back up. It was scary.

Anyways, this is a staple for PC gaming.  It truly is a great game. People still make content about it two decades later, and for good reason.  The graphics did age, but compared to other games of the same era, this one comes out on top for me.

At least today, you don't have the long loading screen times.  You also got the mods, and support. 

I suggest getting the Valve Complete pack, as it offers a great deal on ALL of their titles. You won't be disappointed.
My life got split in half
Really great game. Took me two tries to really get into it but this is amazing, right up there with Half-Life 2
If this is not in your game library, what is wrong with you?

Absolute masterpiece, 100/10, i don't even know where i am in my save but the little i played of it, i loved it, definitely recommended.
Obra de arte absoluta, 100/10, eu nem sei onde que eu tou mais no meu save mais o pouco que joguei dele, eu amei, recomendadíssimo.

so, I've finally finished it, I wasn't sure if i am ever going to play it but thank god i did, this masterpiece from the year i was born in struck me with it's cool ideas and creative situations placement, see, the gameplay is fun but isn’t that sharp the mechanics are some kind wacky but this is a good thing because it forces you to think out of the box, sometimes literally, valve wasn’t always the masters of game-play but rather the master of the game, it feels like there is a hidden directory to guide the situation you face in the game so it is always a blast to find the solution by yourself, they don’t tell they show, and this is a key factor for immersion.

in the end i highly recommend this game because of the story and the creativity that represents valve to its bone.

[h1]Half-Life[/h1]
One of the very first games I've ever bought and one the very first games I've ever completed. Half-Life is a [b]cult classic[/b] that every fan of the FPS genre should play from start to finish.

For the year the game was released, it had everything! An advanced AI, a solid gameplay, a very complex story (too much science for my brain at least lol) and an amazing online multiplayer with various game modes! Hours and hours of fun (and rage too ngl xD) in maps like crossfire and many others!

Made a lot of great memories with this game.

Well, that's all!
Thanks for reading ya'll! :)

Possible contender for one of my favourite games of all time! 

You play as a Black Mesa scientist named Gordon Freeman. You are having a normal day until you head into Sector C test labs and cause a resonance cascade by pushing an unstable  sample into the Anti-Mass Spectrometer. By doing this you open up a portal to the alien world known as Xen. This causes the aliens to raid Black Mesa and kill everyone inside.

Your job as Gordon Freeman is to escape the Facility and try to defend yourself from the Military which is sent in by the government to wipe all witnesses; including scientists.

- Great storytelling
- combat hasn't aged too well but still descent
- cool designs for Xen creatures
- very atmospheric, and bad ass, music (composed by Kelly bailey)
- Very nice set pieces
- Graphics haven't aged too well but you can use HD models if you want to

Overall very good game that i highly recommend to fans of both storytelling in video games and first-person shooters alike!
Love it i can see that hours of effort was putted in it. it is almost 2021 lol

This is the first FPS that I ever played. 
I was a wee little boy at the tender age of 8, when a friend smuggled in a copy of this game, which he stole from his father. We installed it on my laptop and played for hours. It was scary, fascinating, eyeopening. 
And still to this day, when I return to it, it never disappoints. A true masterpiece.

공식 한글화가 그저 감사할 뿐입니다.
더빙이 대단하다는 건 알았지만 처음 접했을 때 웃음이 나오는 건 사실이네요
그래픽은 생각보다 괜찮았습니다.

X무위키를 참조하자면, FOV값 조절은 아래처럼 하시면 됩니다.
steamapps/common/half life/valve 폴더로 가서 
autoexec.cfg라는 파일을 메모장으로 연 뒤(없으면 만드세요)
default_fov <원하는 값> 을 입력한 후 저장하면 됩니다.
최소값은 10, 최대값은 150입니다.
기본값은 90이며, 16:10 모니터에서는 100을, 16:9 모니터에서는 106을 입력하는게 좋다고 하네요.

움직임이 좀 가벼운 느낌(?), 미끄러운 느낌(?)이 심한데, 
게다가 1인칭 시점이라 계단이나 점프 위치 맞추는게 스트레스입니다.
1자 진행이라 길찾기는 그리 어렵진 않았어요.

명작으로 유명하니 옛날 그래픽이 상관없다면 플레이 해보시길 추천합니다.

An oldie but a goodie, Plain and simple. This game is fantastic and is one of the most renowned classics still enjoyed today. The graphics may not be as up to date as most these days, but hell give it a break- the game came out in 1999! Regardless, the story of the black mesa disaster carries the game and makes it enjoyable to no end, and kicks off one of the best series' of all time. -TL;DR- buy this fuckin game
